articles.title: DPRK and Russia Governments Sign Agreement and Protocol
articles.content:
DPRK and Russia Governments Sign Agreement and Protocol
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- An agreement on hand-over and take-over of illegal entrants and sojourners and a protocol of implementation of the agreement were signed between the governments of the DPRK and the Russian Federation in Moscow on Tuesday. 
					 Present at the signing from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Pak Myong Guk and DPRK Ambassador to Russia Kim Hyong Jun and from the Russian side officials concerned of the Federal Emigration Bureau including its Deputy Director N. M. Smorodin and the Foreign Ministry. 
					
					 Pak Myong Guk and N. M. Smorodin signed the agreement and the protocol.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Wu Dawei, special envoy of the Chinese government for the Affairs of the Korean Peninsula, and his party Wednesday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill. 
					 They laid a bouquet before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were conferred on intellectuals with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture Wednesday on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star). 
					 They made great contributions to building a socialist economic power and a highly civilized nation by making big successes in scientific researches and education.
					
					 The title of candidate academician went to Kim Man Su, researcher of the State Academy of Sciences, and Choe Yong Hwi, former head of a department of Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 Professorship was awarded to Sin Kye Ryong, vice-dean of a faculty of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Kwang Won and Ri Won Nam, heads of departments of the university, and others, doctorate to Jong Thae Bong, Kang Chol and An Jong Chon, heads of departments of the university, and others, title of associate professor to 178 persons and master's degree to 734 persons.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomatic Envoys Visit Sci-Tech Complex
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomatic Envoys Visit Sci-Tech Complex
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here visited the Sci-Tech Complex Wednesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the picture of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il at the complex.
					
					 They looked round various places including basic and applied sci-tech halls and e-reading room.
					
					 At the end of the visit, they made an entry in the visitor's book.
					
					 On the same day, they looked round Mirae Scientists Street.

articles.title: DPRK Scholars on U.S. Nuclear Racket
articles.content:
DPRK Scholars on U.S. Nuclear Racket
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the U.S. Defense Department unveiled a video showing a simulation of an A-bomb explosion in the sky above Seoul of south Korea to fan up a nuclear terror among its conservative ruling quarters and military brass-hats.
					 In this regard, Ri Jong Chol, section chief of the Socio-politics Institute under the DPRK Academy of Social Sciences, told KCNA:
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK do not regard fragile forces like the south Korean army as their match, and the DPRK's nuclear force is a powerful deterrent to put an end to the U.S. imperialists' nuclear war moves and blackmail and defend peace.
					
					 Such nuclear racket is intended to escalate the confrontation between the north and the south of Korea, thereby fishing in troubled waters.
					
					 The Korean People's Army has enough conventional weapons to destroy the south Korean army and the U.S. aggression troops present in south Korea at once, and it feels no need to pour nukes on the fellow countrymen in the south.
					
					 The sinister racket can be made only by the U.S. imperialist wolves, who manufactured nukes for the first time in the world and killed hundreds of thousands of innocent civilians with them.
					
					 Upset by the self-defensive step taken by the DPRK, the U.S. ruling quarters are seeking to create a horrible atmosphere in a bid to cover up their aggressive nature. It is just like a thief crying "Stop thief!"
					
					 The U.S. is the kingpin of nuclear blackmail as it causes the world uneasiness with huge amount of nukes capable of inflicting deadly disasters upon all people, including the Korean nation.
					
					 Associate Prof. Ri Ho of Kim Il Sung University said:
					
					 The U.S. perhaps made such video, astounded at the DPRK's successful H-bomb test. This is as foolish an act as a drowning man trying to catch at a straw.
					
					 It cannot be construed otherwise than the last resort of the U.S. in a dilemma as it can neither put harsher sanctions nor conduct a war for fear.
					
					 After all, the present U.S. administration's hostile policy toward the DPRK resulted in the latter's possession of H-bomb and the failure of Obama's "strategic patience".
					
					 Other hostile forces, big or small, dancing to the tune of the U.S., should look into their future through the tragicomic deed of the superpower and clearly know that they will get nothing from blindly following it crying for sanctions.

articles.title: Sports Games to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Sports Games to Mark Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Colorful sports games will be held in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (Feb. 16), the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among them are the 24th Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival to be held at the Ice Rink and the synchronized swimming demonstration in the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex from Feb. 15 to 17.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Paektusan Prize Sports Contest, which began on Monday, is scheduled to go on till the end of this month.
					
					 The contest includes a number of sports events like football, basketball and short-track speed skating.

articles.title: Preparations for 20th Kimjongilia Festival Brisk
articles.content:
Preparations for 20th Kimjongilia Festival Brisk
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Preparations for the 20th Kimjongilia Festival are making brisk headway in the DPRK.
					 The theme of the festival is "Kimjongilia in full bloom all over Songun Korea making a leap forward with youthful vigor".
					
					 The preparatory committee of the festival is pushing ahead with such works as making miniatures of the festival venue and its parts and creating posters.
					
					 Preparations for the festival are also gaining momentum at armed forces organs, commissions, ministries, national institutions and many other units.
					
					 Meanwhile, working people and youth and schoolchildren in Pyongyang are doing their best to bring up Kimjongilia with great care.
					
					 The same festivals will take place in every province of the country.
					
					 The 1st Kimjongilia Festival was held in Juche 86 (1997) to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (February 16).

articles.title: Drilling Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology
articles.content:
Drilling Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Drilling Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology is known as the group of able teachers in the DPRK. Most of them are doctors and associate professors.
					 They have achieved a number of successes in putting the education on a practical, comprehensive and modern basis.
					
					 They worked out more than 80 model teaching plans on major subject and upgraded various experimental apparatuses and devices, thus making contribution to increasing the proportion of experiments and practical training in education.
					
					 And they also built up a multimedia database for major subject to improve the effectiveness and visual quality of teaching.
					
					 Recently, they succeeded in developing a new technology to begin home production of diamond crown.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Roll back Its Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary slams the U.S. ruling quarters for their absurd assertion that the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons poses threat to the U.S. and world peace.
					 This is a sheer lie and foolish sophism, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has threatened and blackmailed not a few countries with its nuclear weapons since it emerged a nuclear superpower.
					
					 Almost all the former socialist countries were the targets of the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail. After the end of the Cold War, such countries were free from the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail with exception for the DPRK. On the contrary, the U.S. spawned the non-existent nuclear issue of the DPRK, escalating the nuclear threat and blackmail to it.
					
					 Not content with seeking unpardonable and unprecedented political isolation of the DPRK and bringing economic blockade and military pressure upon it for the mere reason that it has differing ideology and social system and has not yielded to the ambition for aggression, the U.S. has worked hard to inflict even a nuclear disaster on it.
					
					 That's why the DPRK was compelled to make a bold decision to put an end to the U.S. moves for aggression based on the nuclear threat and blackmail with its own nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK and the U.S., nuclear weapons states, are now standing in acute confrontation in the Korean Peninsula. The U.S. ruling quarters are wholly to blame for this situation.
					
					 The prevailing situation is by no means favorable for the U.S. The only way of putting it under control is for the U.S. to make the earliest possible policy switchover.
					
					 The more persistently the U.S. pursues its hostile policy toward the DPRK, the more awkward position it will find itself in.
					
					 The U.S. ruling quarters should not try to deny truth but make a bold decision to roll back their hostile policy toward the DPRK as early as possible.

articles.title: Japan Is Bound to Go to Final Ruin: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan Is Bound to Go to Final Ruin: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities were compelled to sit at negotiating table with the south Korean authorities in a bid to solve the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. But they refused to make proper apology and admit state responsibility for it and attempted to cover up Japan's past crimes by paying a petty amount of money to its victims. And they declared that the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army found a legal and "final solution" and they would no longer own any responsibility to redress their past wrongs.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The war crimes committed by Japan in the past including the sexual slavery for the  Imperial Japanese Army can be solved only through Japan's sincere apology, admission of state responsibility and honest reparation. 
					
					 The Japanese authorities, however, do not look sincere in this respect.
					
					 Japan claims that it did nothing wrong in the past and it is, therefore, not obliged to own any responsibility for liquidating the past. This is the Japanese reactionaries' present understanding of history.
					
					 Having such perverted view of history and immoral perception, the Japanese reactionaries have Japan's past crimes including the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army unsettled till now over seven decades since the war.
					
					 They should bear in mind that to what path their unreasonable attitude towards the past crimes is leading Japan.
					
					 Morally corrupt and degenerate Japan is bound to go to a final ruin, warns the commentary.

articles.title: U.S. Introduction of Germ Weapons into S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Introduction of Germ Weapons into S. Korea under Fire
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- More cases of U.S. introduction of pest virus into the base of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea were disclosed.
					 Last year it was brought to light that the U.S. introduced not only anthrax germ and botulinus germ but also pest virus into the Osan U.S. air force base according to the "Jupiter plan" for rounding off the system of the biochemical war.
					
					 Much upset by this, the U.S. claimed that pest virus was delivered last year for the first time, in a bid to cover up its criminal act. 
					
					 However, it was recently disclosed that its assertion was little short of an excuse and it had long conducted the tests for the germ warfare after introducing pest virus into south Korea.
					
					 Such fact was revealed by a report of an institute of the U.S. opened to public by the south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on Jan. 27.
					
					 According to it, the institute is sending anthrax germ and pest virus to other institutes of the world.
					
					 In March, 2014 it sent live anthrax germ and pest virus to south Korea and their amount quadrupled that last year.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Retry Victims of April 3 Uprising
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Retry Victims of April 3 Uprising 
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on Tuesday in an editorial accused the authorities of trying to retry victims of the April 3 Uprising. 
					 Recalling that the "prime minister" said those who violated the liberal and democratic order among the victims of the April 3 Uprising should be excluded from the list of the victims through hearing, the editorial went on:
					
					 His outpouring made clear "the government's" intention to retry victims of the April 3 Uprising. 
					
					 From the beginning the present regime has branded the political opposition forces as "followers of the north" and suppressed them. 
					
					 The retrial of victims of the April 3 Uprising is nothing but an attempt to push history back and divide the people by dint of ideology. 
					
					 The "president" should stop the immoral act of making an ideological review of victims in order to reflect on the mistake committed under "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Actions against Authorities' Humiliating Act Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Authorities' Humiliating Act Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Actions of people of various circles are mounting in south Korea against the authorities' humiliating act of covering up the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo.
					 A rally was held at Seoul Square on January 30 by the "national action for the nullification of the south Korea-Japan agreement on the comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army and its just settlement." It is made up of at least 380 civic organizations including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps.
					
					 Another rally took place before the girl statue in front of the building of the Japanese embassy in Seoul under the sponsorship of the "Measure Committee of Students for Denouncing the south Korea-Japan Agreement."
					
					 Speakers underscored the need to carry on the actions till the humiliating "agreement" is nullified.
					
					 On the same day a demo was staged in Seoul to denounce the shameful humiliating act of the authorities and demand the proper solution of the issue of sexual slavery.

articles.title: "Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery Slammed
articles.content:
"Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery Slammed
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Ansan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued a statement on Feb. 2 to denounce the "agreement" between Japan and south Korea on the issue of sexual slavery, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The negotiations ignoring the demand of victims are disturbing in the intention, course, results and all other aspects, the statement said, asserting that lurking behind this is an attempt to fabricate the south Korea-U.S.-Japan triangular military alliance.
					
					 The U.S. exercised its influence behind the scene and pressurized south Korea to join the U.S.-led alliance, resulting in producing a humiliating "agreement", it charged.
					
					 The triangular military alliance will result in rendering south Korea militarily dependent on the U.S. and escalating military tension in the Korean Peninsula and, furthermore, in Northeast Asia, it said.
					
					 This is an act of trampling down the desire of the people for peace and reunification, it noted, adding that the Ansan citizens demand the nullification of the "agreement".
					
					 It expressed the will to further the action to nullify the "agreement" by erecting a girl statue in Ansan City, Kyonggi Province, too.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Distorting Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Distorting Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany issued a statement on Feb. 1 to denounce Japan for distorting its past crimes.
					 The statement accused the Japanese government of still denying the forcible drafting for sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The official stand of Japan that "there is no evidence proving the forcible drafting of 'comfort women' for the Imperial Japanese Army" was opened to public on Jan. 31. This shows the real picture of the Japanese government, a barbarian regime.
					
					 Never to be erased are historical records and testimonies proving the fact that the Japanese imperialists forcibly drafted even women of Asia and Europe as sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army, seized with the wild dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" in the last century.
					
					 Japan is getting frantic in the moves to distort the history-woven with monstrous war crimes and trample down justice, far from making sincere apology and reflection on the bestial war crimes which make even brutes blush. This is another unpardonable criminal act.
					
					 The statement demanded Japan admit and apologize to the international community for the forcible drafting for sexual slavery.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Myanmar Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Myanmar Personages
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Myanmar personages issued statements on Jan. 27 and 28 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said he deemed it an honor to celebrate the Day of the Shining Star together with the Korean people. He went on:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il is the benevolent father of the people as he firmly united all the people with politics of love and trust and devoted his all to their happiness. 
					
					 Progressive people are paying the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who made great contribution to accomplishing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The general director of a Myanmar publishing house said:
					
					 Not only the Korean people but also the world progressives are praising the idea and exploits of Kim Jong Il who devoted his all to the country and its people and global independence and significantly celebrating the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 He developed and enriched the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung into the guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 The immortal exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence will be kept forever in the mind of progressive mankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Iranian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Iranian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Jan. 27th issue of the Iranian newspaper Iran News allotted one whole page to a special write-up titled "Immortal exploits for peace" on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It carried a photo of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together, a photo of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un standing together and a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The exploits of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il will be eternally recorded in the history as he smashed the imperialists' aggression, high-handed and arbitrary practices which were rampant in the world and safeguarded peace and security by pursuing the original Songun politics.
					
					 He pursued the Songun politics, providing a reliable guarantee for ensuring peace in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Bearing in mind the immutable truth that the weak military force can neither defend the security of the country and nation nor safeguard peace, he provided his first field guidance for his Songun revolutionary leadership to a guards unit of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960.
					
					 He made a ceaseless long journey for Songun leadership since then.
					
					 He smashed every U.S. military provocation and attempt to invade the DPRK with his matchless pluck and grit, the newspaper said, adding that he fully displayed his personality and qualification as a brilliant commander in the U.S. armed spy ship Pueblo incident, large-sized spy plane EC-121 incident, Panmunjom incident and nuclear crisis in the Korean Peninsula in the 1990s.

articles.title: Ethiopian Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed
articles.content:
Ethiopian Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- An Ethiopian preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu was formed in Addis Ababa on January 28.
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events for significantly celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A Cambodian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on January 30.
					 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister for Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee on the instructions of King Norodom Sihamoni.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and organize diverse political and cultural events on the above-said occasions.

articles.title: DPRK Will Never Abandon Nuclear Program: Egyptian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK Will Never Abandon Nuclear Program: Egyptian Organization
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Egypt-Korea Friendship Association posted on its website an article titled "The DPRK will never abandon its nuclear program" on Jan. 24 as regards its successful first H-bomb test.
					 The article said that the U.S. has sought its hostile policy toward the DPRK since its founding.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK has resolutely stood against the U.S. hostile moves, to be precise the aggression moves for encroaching upon the country's sovereignty and people's interests.
					
					 The DPRK had access to the nuclear deterrent including H-bomb in order to defend itself from the U.S. persistent military threat.
					
					 The DPRK regarded it as the only way for ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula to conclude a peace treaty and raised it to the U.S.
					
					 But the U.S. and its followers have conducted large-scale military drills against the Korean people.
					
					 Hence, the DPRK expressed its will to steadily bolster up its nuclear force in order to safeguard the country's sovereignty and vital rights of the people.

articles.title: Conclusion of Peace Treaty between DPRK and U.S. Demanded by Brazilian Political Figure
articles.content:
Conclusion of Peace Treaty between DPRK and U.S. Demanded by Brazilian Political Figure
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Brazilian Communist Party made public a statement on Jan. 19 in demand of the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.
					 The secretary said that though more than a half century has passed since the Korean War, the Korean Peninsula is now in the state of truce and war as a peace treaty is not concluded. He went on:
					
					 The U.S. should explain the reason why it is sidestepping the DPRK's proposal for concluding the peace treaty.
					
					 We regard it as one of our basic ideas to safeguard world peace.
					
					 So we strongly denounce U.S. imperialism for having systematically violated the NPT and desperately denied the nuclear disarmament.
					
					 The U.S. will not be able to escape the disastrous nuclear holocaust in case it recklessly resorts to the moves for stifling the DPRK.
					
					 The stance of the DPRK to further bolster up its nuclear deterrent is based on the principle of self-defense, the right of all countries.
					
					 The world should respect the DPRK's just stance.

articles.title: Rubricado en Moscu acuerdo entre gobiernos de RPDC y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado en Moscu acuerdo entre gobiernos de RPDC y Rusia
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedaron rubricados el dia 2 en Moscu el acuerdo sobre la entrega y el recibo de las personas que entran o permanecen ilegalmente en los respectivos paises entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa y el protocolo para ejecutarlo.
					En la ceremonia de firma estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, los miembros de la delegacion de MINREX de la RPDC, encabezada por el viceministro Pak Myong Guk y el embajador coreano en Rusia, Kim Hyong Jun, y por la rusa, el subdirector N. M. Smorodin y otros relacionados del Buro de Emigracion Federal y el MINREX de Rusia.
					
					El viceministro coreano y el subdirector ruso firmaron el acuerdo y el protocolo.

articles.title: Wu Dawei y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Wu Dawei y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Wu Dawei, representante especial del gobierno chino para asuntos de la Peninsula Coreana, y su comitiva rindieron el dia 3 el postumo homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il tras depositar un ramo de flores ante sus estatuas de bronce erguidas en la capitalina colina Mansu.

articles.title: Otorgados en RPDC grados academicos y categorias docentes
articles.content:
Otorgados en RPDC grados academicos y categorias docentes
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il (16 de febrero), fueron otorgados los grados academicos y las categorias docentes a los intelectuales quienes hicieron gran contribucion a la construccion de la potencia economica socialista y el pais civilizado al lograr muchos exitos en la investigacion cientifica y la labor docente.
					El acto de otorgamiento tuvo lugar el dia 3 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo.
					
					Fueron concedidos los titulos del Candidato al Academico a Kim Man Su, investigador de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias,  y al ex jefe de catedra de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Choe Yong Hwi.
					
					 Tambien, fue otorgado el grado de Profesor Titular al subdecano Sin Kye Ryong, los jefes de catedras Kim Kwang Won y Ri Won Nam, de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, etc.
					
					El titulo del Doctor se concedio a Jong Thae Bong, Kang Chol, An Jong Chon, jefes de catedras de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, etc., la categoria de Candidato al Profesor Titular, a 178 personas y el licenciamiento a 734.

articles.title: Se celebraran actividades deportivas por Dia de Estrella Luz
articles.content:
Se celebraran actividades deportivas por Dia de Estrella Luz
Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero-dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il) tendran lugar en esta capital diversas actividades deportivas.
					En el Complejo de Patinaje bajo Techo, situado a la orilla del rio Pothong, se efectuara del dia 15 al 17 el XXIV Festival Internacional de Patinaje Artistico sobre el Hielo por el Premio Paektusan con la participacion de los jugadores sobresalientes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y otros paises.
					
					En el mismo periodo habra una presentacion modelo de natacion sincronica en la piscina del Complejo de Servicios de Higiene Changgwang.
					
					Ademas, bajo la atencion de los aficionados al deporte, se desarrollara durante casi un mes desde el primero de febrero la Competencia Deportiva por el Premio Paektusan.
					
					En el marco de esta actividad deportiva se realizaran diversas disciplinas como futbol, baloncesto, patinaje de velocidad de pista corta, etc.
